errors.error_description: The instructions attempt to upgrade pip before activating the virtual environment, which will modify the global Python environment instead of the isolated one.
correction_candidates: python3 -m venv acme && source acme/bin/activate && pip install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel
Move the `source acme/bin/activate` command before the `pip install --upgrade pip...` command.
The commands are correct but should be run in separate terminals.
errors.golden_answer: Move the `source acme/bin/activate` command before the `pip install --upgrade pip...` command.

errors.error_description: The command to install from the cloned GitHub repository has a syntax error, using a comma instead of a period to specify the local package.
The command `python -m venv acme` is used, which may default to an unsupported Python 2 installation on some systems, leading to compatibility issues. `python3` should be used explicitly.
correction_candidates: Ensure your system's default 'python' is aliased to 'python3' before running.

errors.error_description: The command to activate the virtual environment is incorrect (`source acme/activate`). The correct path to the activation script is `acme/bin/activate`.
